member.name: T:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio
member.summary: An MSBuild task that provides support for running Gallio tests.
member.remarks:
In order for MSBuild to find this task, the Gallio.MSBuildTasks.dll has to be loaded with the UsingTask directive:
<UsingTask AssemblyFile="[Path-to-assembly]\Gallio.MSBuildTasks.dll" TaskName="Gallio" />
The AssemblyFile attribute must be set to the path where the Gallio.MSBuildTasks.dll assembly resides, and the TaskName attribute must be set to "Gallio", otherwise MSBuild won't load the task.
member.example:
The following code is an example build file that shows how to load the task, specify the test files and assemblies and set some of the task's properties:
<Project xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003"> <!-- This is needed by MSBuild to locate the Gallio task --> <UsingTask AssemblyFile="[Path-to-assembly]\Gallio.MSBuildTasks.dll" TaskName="Gallio" /> <!-- Specify the test files and assemblies --> <ItemGroup> <TestFile Include="[Path-to-test-assembly1]/TestAssembly1.dll" /> <TestFile Include="[Path-to-test-assembly2]/TestAssembly2.dll" /> <TestFile Include="[Path-to-test-script1]/TestScript1_spec.rb" /> <TestFile Include="[Path-to-test-script2]/TestScript2.xml" /> </ItemGroup> <Target Name="RunTests"> <Gallio IgnoreFailures="true" Filter="Type=SomeFixture" Files="@(TestFile)"> <!-- This tells MSBuild to store the output value of the task's ExitCode property into the project's ExitCode property --> <Output TaskParameter="ExitCode" PropertyName="ExitCode"/> </Gallio> <Error Text="Tests execution failed" Condition="'$(ExitCode)' != 0" /> </Target> </Project>

member.name: M:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.RunLauncher(Gallio.Runner.TestLauncher)
member.summary: Provided so that the unit tests can override test execution behavior.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.Files
member.summary: The list of relative or absolute paths of test files, projects and assemblies to execute. Wildcards may be used. This is required.
member.example:
The following example shows how to specify the test files, projects and assemblies (for a more complete example please see the task documentation):
<!-- Specify the test files, projects and assemblies --> <ItemGroup> <TestFile Include="[Path-to-test-assembly1]/TestAssembly1.dll" /> <TestFile Include="[Path-to-test-assembly2]/TestAssembly2.dll" /> <TestFile Include="[Path-to-test-script1]/TestScript1_spec.rb" /> <TestFile Include="[Path-to-test-script2]/TestScript2.xml" /> </ItemGroup> <Target Name="MyTarget"> <Gallio Files="@(TestFile)" /> </Target>

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.HintDirectories
member.summary: The list of directories used for loading referenced assemblies and other dependent resources.
member.example:
The following example shows how to specify the hint directories:
<ItemGroup> <HintDirectory Include="[Path-to-test-hint-directory-1]/" /> <HintDirectory Include="[Path-to-test-hint-directory-2]/" /> </ItemGroup> <Target Name="MyTarget"> <Gallio HintDirectories="@(HintDirectory)" /> </Target>

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.PluginDirectories
member.summary: Additional Gallio plugin directories to search recursively.
member.example:
The following example shows how to specify the plugins directories:
<ItemGroup> <PluginDirectory Include="[Path-to-test-plugin-directory-1]/" /> <PluginDirectory Include="[Path-to-test-plugin-directory-2]/" /> </ItemGroup> <Target Name="MyTarget"> <Gallio PluginDirectories="@(PluginDirectory)" /> </Target>

summary.para: Gets or sets the relative or absolute path of the application base directory, or null to use a default value selected by the consumer.
If relative, the path is based on the current working directory, so a value of "" causes the current working directory to be used.
Gets or sets the relative or absolute path of the working directory or null to use a default value selected by the consumer.
If relative, the path is based on the current working directory, so a value of "" causes the current working directory to be used.
Enables shadow copying when set to true.
Shadow copying allows the original assemblies to be modified while the tests are running. However, shadow copying may occasionally cause some tests to fail if they depend on their original location.
Attaches the debugger to the test process when set to true.
Gets or sets the version of the .Net runtime to use for running tests.
For the CLR, this must be the name of one of the framework directories in %SystemRoot%\Microsoft.Net\Framework. eg. 'v2.0.50727'.
The default is null which uses the most recent installed and supported framework.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.ReportTypes
member.summary: A list of the types of reports to generate, separated by semicolons.

list.item: The types supported "out of the box" are: Html, Html-Condensed, Text, Text-Condendes, XHtml, XHtml-Condensed, MHtml, MHtml-CondensedXml, and Xml-Inline, but more types could be available as plugins.
The report types are not case sensitive.

member.example:
In the following example reports will be generated in both HTML and XML format:
<Target Name="MyTarget"> <Gallio ReportTypes="html;xml" /> </Target>

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.ReportArchive
member.summary: Sets the report archive mode.

remarks.para:
The supported modes are:
Normal (default)
Zip

member.example:
In the following example, reports will be enclosed in a zip file:
<Target Name="MyTarget"> <Gallio ReportArchive="zip" /> </Target>

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.ReportNameFormat
member.summary: Sets the format string to use to generate the reports filenames.
member.remarks: Any occurence of {0} will be replaced by the date, and any occurrence of {1} by the time. The default format string is test-report-{0}-{1}.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.ReportDirectory
member.summary: Sets the name of the directory where the reports will be put.
member.remarks: The directory will be created if it doesn't exist. Existing files will be overwritten. The default report directory is "Reports".

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.RunnerType
member.summary: Sets the type of test runner to use.

list.item: The types supported "out of the box" are: Local, IsolatedAppDomain and IsolatedProcess (default), but more types could be available as plugins.
The runner types are not case sensitive.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.RunnerExtensions

summary.para: Specifies the type, assembly, and parameters of custom test runner extensions to use during the test run in the form: '[Namespace.]Type,Assembly[;Parameters]'.

member.remarks: Since semicolons are used to delimit multiple property values in MSBuild, it may be necessary to escape semicolons that appear as part of test runner extension specifications to ensure MSBuild does not misinterpret them. An escaped semicolon may be written as "%3B" in the build file.
member.example:
The following example runs tests using a custom logger extension:
<Target Name="MyTarget"> <Gallio Files="MyTestAssembly.dll" RunnerExtensions="FancyLogger,MyExtensions.dll%3BColorOutput,FancyIndenting" /> </Target>

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.RunnerProperties
member.summary: Specifies option property key/value pairs for the test runner.
member.example:
The following example specifies some extra NCover arguments.
<gallio> <Target Name="MyTarget"> <Gallio Files="MyTestAssembly.dll" RunnerExtensions="NCoverArguments='//eas Gallio'" /> </Target>

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.ReportFormatterProperties
member.summary: Specifies option property key/value pairs for the report formatter.
member.example:
The following example changes the default attachment content disposition for the reports.
<Target Name="MyTarget"> <Gallio Files="MyTestAssembly.dll" RunnerExtensions="AttachmentContentDisposition=Absent" /> </Target>

summary.para: Sets the filter set to apply, which consists of a sequence of one or more inclusion or exclusion filter rules prefixed using 'include' (optional) or 'exclude'.

remarks.para: A filter rule consists of zero or more filter expressions that may be combined using 'and', 'or', and 'not' and grouped with parentheses. A filter expression consists of a filter key followed by one or more comma-delimited matching values in the form 'key: value, "quoted value", /regular expression/'.
The filter grammar is defined as follows:

para.code:
INCLUDE ::= "include" # Not case-sensitive EXCLUDE ::= "exclude" # Not case-sensitive
OR ::= "or" # Not case-sensitive AND ::= "and" # Not case-sensitive NOT ::= "not" # Not case-sensitive
<unquotedWord> ::= [^:,*()/\"']+
<quotedWord> ::= '"' .* '"' # String delimited by double quotation marks | "'" .* "'" # String delimited by single quotation marks
<word> ::= <unquotedWord> | <quotedWord>
<regexWord> ::= "/" .* "/" # Regular expression | "/" .* "/i" # Case-insensitive regular expression
<key> ::= <word>
<value> ::= <word> # Value specified by exact string | <regexWord> # Value specified by regular expression
<matchSequence> ::= <value> (',' <value>)* # One or more comma-separated values
<filterExpr> ::= "*" # "Any" | <key> ":" matchSeq> | <filterExpr> OR filterExpr> # Combine filter expressions with OR | <filterExpr> AND filterExpr> # Combine filter expressions with AND | NOT <filterExpr> # Negate filter expression | "(" <filterExpr> ")" # Grouping filter expression
<filterRule> ::= <filterExpr> # Inclusion rule (default case) | INCLUDE <filterExpr> # Inclusion rule | EXCLUDE <filterExpr> # Exclusion rule
<filterSet> ::= <filterRule> # Filter set consists of at least one filter rule. | <filterRule> <filterSet> # But may be a sequence of rules.

list.item: By default this property takes the value "*", which means the "Any" filter will be applied.
The operator precedence is, from highest to lowest: NOT, AND, and OR. All these operators are left-associative.
The commas used to separate the values are interpreted as OR operators, so "Type:Fixture1,Fixture2" is equivalent to "Type:Fixture1 or Type:Fixture2".
White-space is ignored outside quoted strings, so "Type:Fixture1|Type:Fixture2" is equivalent to "Type : Fixture1 | Type : Fixture2".

Commas, colons, slashes, backslashes and quotation marks can be escaped with a backslash. For example, \' will be interpreted as '. Using a single backslash in front of any other character is invalid.

Currently the following filter keys are recognized:
Id: Filter by id.
Name: Filter by name.
Assembly: Filter by assembly name.
Namespace: Filter by namespace name.
Type: Filter by type name, including inherited types.
ExactType: Filter by type name, excluding inherited types.
Member: Filter by member name.
*: All other names are assumed to correspond to metadata keys. See for standard metadata keys. Common keys are: AuthorName, Category, Description, Importance, TestsOn.

example.para: Assuming the following fixtures have been defined:
The following filters could be applied:

item.description: All the tests within Fixture1 will be run.
Only Fixture1.Test1 and Fixture2.Test1 will be run.
All the tests within Fixture1 or Fixture2 will be run.
All the tests within Fixture1 or Fixture2 will be run.
Only Fixture1.Test2 and Fixture2.Test2 will be run.
Only Fixture1.Test2 and Fixture2.Test2 will be run.
All the tests within Fixture1 will be run because its author attribute is set to "AlbertEinstein".
All the tests within Fixture2 will be run because its category attribute is set to "IntegrationTest".
All the tests will be run. This example also shows that you can enclose key and values with quotation marks, and group expressions with parentheses.
All the tests within Fixture2 will be run because its author attribute is not set to "AlbertEinstein".

item.term: exclude Type: Fixture2 include Member: Test2
item.description: Only Fixture1.Test2 will be run because Fixture2 was excluded from consideration before the inclusion rule was applied.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.IgnoreFailures
member.summary: Sets whether test failures will be ignored and allow the build to proceed. When set to false, test failures will cause the build to fail.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.ShowReports
member.summary: Sets whether to show generated reports in a window using the default system application registered to the report file type.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.DoNotRun
member.summary: Sets whether to load the tests but not run them. This option may be used to produce a report that contains test metadata for consumption by other tools.

summary.para: Sets whether to ignore annotations when determining the result code. If false (default), then error annotations, usually indicative of broken tests, will cause a failure result to be generated.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.EchoResults
member.summary: Sets whether to echo results to the screen as tests finish. If this option is set to true, the default, test results are echoed to the console in varying detail depending on the current verbosity level. Otherwise only final summary statistics are displayed.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.RunTimeLimit
member.summary: Sets the maximum amount of time (in seconds) the tests can run before they are canceled. The default is an infinite time to run.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.Verbosity
member.summary: The verbosity to use when logging. The default is "Normal".

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.ExitCode
member.summary: Gets the exit code of the tests execution.
member.remarks: This property is only meaningful when the IgnoreFailures property is set to true.
member.example:
To use this property, you need to include an Output tag within the Gallio tag to specify a name to reference it:
<Gallio> <!-- This tells MSBuild that the task's ExitCode output property will be made available as a property called ExitCode in the project after the tests have been run: --> <Output TaskParameter="ExitCode" PropertyName="ExitCode"/> </Gallio> <!-- After the exit code be retrieved and used like this: --> <Error Text="The tests execution failed" Condition="'$(ExitCode)' != 0" />

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.TestCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of test cases run.
member.example:
To use this property, you need to include an Output tag within the Gallio tag to specify a name to reference it:
<Gallio> <!-- This tells MSBuild that the task's TestCount output property will be made available as a property called TestCount in the project after the tests have been run: --> <Output TaskParameter="TestCount" PropertyName="TestCount" /> </Gallio> <!-- After execution the number of test cases run can be retrieved like this: --> <Message Text="$(TestCount) test cases were run." />

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.StepCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of test steps run.
member.example:
To use this property, you need to include an Output tag within the Gallio tag to specify a name to reference it:
<Gallio> <!-- This tells MSBuild that the task's StepCount output property will be made available as a property called StepCount in the project after the tests have been run: --> <Output TaskParameter="StepCount" PropertyName="StepCount" /> </Gallio> <!-- After execution the number of test steps run can be retrieved like this: --> <Message Text="$(StepCount) test steps were run." />

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.PassedCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of test cases that were run and passed.
member.example:
To use this property, you need to include an Output tag within the Gallio tag to specify a name to reference it:
<Gallio> <!-- This tells MSBuild that the task's PassedCount output property will be made available as a property called PassedCount in the project after the tests have been run: --> <Output TaskParameter="PassedCount" PropertyName="PassedCount" /> </Gallio> <!-- After execution the number of passed tests can be retrieved like this: --> <Message Text="$(PassedCount) tests passed." />

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.FailedCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of test cases that were run and failed.
member.example:
To use this property, you need to include an Output tag within the Gallio tag to specify a name to reference it:
<Gallio> <!-- This tells MSBuild that the task's FailedCount output property will be made available as a property called FailedCount in the project after the tests have been run: --> <Output TaskParameter="FailedCount" PropertyName="FailedCount" /> </Gallio> <!-- After execution the number of failed tests can be retrieved like this: --> <Message Text="$(FailedCount) tests passed." />

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.InconclusiveCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of test cases that ran and were inconclusive.
member.example:
To use this property, you need to include an Output tag within the Gallio tag to specify a name to reference it:
<Gallio> <!-- This tells MSBuild that the task's InconclusiveCount output property will be made available as a property called InconclusiveCount in the project after the tests have been run: --> <Output TaskParameter="InconclusiveCount" PropertyName="InconclusiveCount" /> </Gallio> <!-- After execution the number of inconclusive tests can be retrieved like this: --> <Message Text="$(InconclusiveCount) tests were inconclusive." />

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.RunCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of test cases that were run.
member.example:
To use this property, you need to include an Output tag within the Gallio tag to specify a name to reference it:
<Gallio> <!-- This tells MSBuild that the task's RunCount output property will be made available as a property called RunCount in the project after the tests have been run: --> <Output TaskParameter="RunCount" PropertyName="RunCount" /> </Gallio> <!-- After execution the number of tests run can be retrieved like this: --> <Message Text="$(RunCount) tests were run." />

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.SkippedCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of test cases that did not run because they were skipped.
member.example:
To use this property, you need to include an Output tag within the Gallio tag to specify a name to reference it:
<Gallio> <!-- This tells MSBuild that the task's SkippedCount output property will be made available as a property called SkippedCount in the project after the tests have been run: --> <Output TaskParameter="SkippedCount" PropertyName="SkippedCount" /> </Gallio> <!-- After execution the number of skipped tests can be retrieved like this: --> <Message Text="$(SkippedCount) tests were skipped." />

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.Duration
member.summary: Gets the duration of the tests execution in seconds.
member.example:
To use this property, you need to include an Output tag within the Gallio tag to specify a name to reference it:
<Gallio> <!-- This tells MSBuild that the task's Duration output property will be made available as a property called Duration in the project after the tests have been run: --> <Output TaskParameter="Duration" PropertyName="Duration" /> </Gallio> <!-- After execution the duration can be retrieved like this: --> <Message Text="The tests took $(Duration)s to execute." />

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Gallio.AssertCount
member.summary: Gets the number of assertions evaluated.
member.example:
To use this property, you need to include an Output tag within the Gallio tag to specify a name to reference it:
<Gallio> <!-- This tells MSBuild that the task's AssertionCount output property will be made available as a property called AssertionCount in the project after the tests have been run: --> <Output TaskParameter="AssertionCount" PropertyName="AssertionCount" /> </Gallio> <!-- After execution the number of assertions can be retrieved like this: --> <Message Text="$(AssertionCount) assertions were evaluated." />

member.name: T:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Gallio.MSBuildTasks namespace contains MSBuild tasks for Gallio.

member.name: T:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.TaskLogger
member.summary: Logs messages to a instance.

member.name: T:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Properties.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Properties.Resources.DefaultReportNameFormat
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to test-report-{0}-{1}.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Properties.Resources.TaskNameAndVersion
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Gallio MSBuild Task - Version {0}.

member.name: P:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.Properties.Resources.UnexpectedErrorDuringExecution
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An unexpected error occurred during execution of the Gallio task..

member.name: T:Gallio.MSBuildTasks.TaskLogExtension
member.summary: Logs messages to a instance for test results.
